Description: Checks that each customer_id in tsb.customer_data_bank is unique, ensuring no duplicate primary key values exist, which is critical for entity identification and referential integrity.
Custom_SQL: SELECT customer_id, COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank GROUP BY customer_id HAVING COUNT(*) > 1

Description: Ensures that the customer_id field, defined as NOT NULL and PRIMARY KEY, does not contain any NULL values, which would violate entity integrity.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE customer_id IS NULL

Description: Checks for missing values in the full_name column, which may be important for customer identification and communication.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE full_name IS NULL

Description: Checks for missing values in the date_of_birth column, which may be required for age calculations and regulatory compliance.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE date_of_birth IS NULL

Description: Checks for missing values in the gender column, which may be necessary for demographic analysis and reporting.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE gender IS NULL

Description: Checks for missing values in the address column, which are important for contact and verification purposes.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE address IS NULL

Description: Checks for missing values in the phone_number column, which are important for customer communication and verification.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE phone_number IS NULL

Description: Checks for missing values in the email_address column, which are important for digital communication and notifications.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE email_address IS NULL

Description: Checks for missing values in the national_id_or_passport_number column, which may be required for KYC (Know Your Customer) and regulatory compliance.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE national_id_or_passport_number IS NULL

Description: Checks for missing values in the occupation column, which may be important for customer profiling and risk assessment.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE occupation IS NULL

Description: Checks for missing values in the customer_type column, which may be necessary for segmentation and service eligibility.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE customer_type IS NULL

Description: Checks for missing values in the account_numbers column, which may indicate incomplete customer records.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE account_numbers IS NULL

Description: Checks for missing values in the age column, which may be required for eligibility and risk profiling.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE age IS NULL

Description: Checks for missing values in the created_by column, which is important for auditing and traceability of record creation.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE created_by IS NULL

Description: Checks for missing values in the created_on column, which is important for auditing and record lifecycle tracking.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE created_on IS NULL

Description: Checks for missing values in the modified_by column, which is important for auditing and traceability of record modifications.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE modified_by IS NULL

Description: Checks for missing values in the modified_on column, which is important for auditing and record update tracking.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE modified_on IS NULL

Description: Checks for missing values in the status column, which may be important for workflow and customer lifecycle management.
Custom_SQL: SELECT COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE status IS NULL

Description: Checks for duplicate values in the national_id_or_passport_number column, which should typically be unique for each customer to prevent identity duplication.
Custom_SQL: SELECT national_id_or_passport_number, COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE national_id_or_passport_number IS NOT NULL GROUP BY national_id_or_passport_number HAVING COUNT(*) > 1

Description: Checks for duplicate values in the email_address column, which should typically be unique for each customer to prevent multiple accounts per email.
Custom_SQL: SELECT email_address, COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE email_address IS NOT NULL GROUP BY email_address HAVING COUNT(*) > 1

Description: Checks for duplicate values in the phone_number column, which should typically be unique for each customer to prevent multiple accounts per phone number.
Custom_SQL: SELECT phone_number, COUNT(*) FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE phone_number IS NOT NULL GROUP BY phone_number HAVING COUNT(*) > 1

Description: Checks that email_address values conform to a basic email format, ensuring validity for communication and reducing errors.
Custom_SQL: SELECT email_address FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE email_address IS NOT NULL AND email_address !~* '^[A-Za-z0-9._%+-]+@[A-Za-z0-9.-]+\.[A-Za-z]{2,}$'

Description: Checks that phone_number values contain only digits, spaces, plus, hyphens, or parentheses, ensuring valid contact information.
Custom_SQL: SELECT phone_number FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE phone_number IS NOT NULL AND phone_number !~* '^[0-9+\-\(\) ]+$'

Description: Checks that gender values are within expected domain (e.g., Male, Female, Other, Unknown), ensuring data consistency and validity.
Custom_SQL: SELECT gender FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE gender IS NOT NULL AND gender NOT IN ('Male','Female','Other','Unknown')

Description: Checks that status values are within expected domain (e.g., Active, Inactive, Suspended), ensuring valid customer lifecycle status.
Custom_SQL: SELECT status FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE status IS NOT NULL AND status NOT IN ('Active','Inactive','Suspended')

Description: Checks that age values are non-negative, as negative ages are logically invalid.
Custom_SQL: SELECT customer_id, age FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE age IS NOT NULL AND age < 0

Description: Checks that the age value corresponds to the date_of_birth, ensuring consistency between derived and stored values.
Custom_SQL: SELECT customer_id, age, date_of_birth FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE age IS NOT NULL AND date_of_birth IS NOT NULL AND age <> EXTRACT(YEAR FROM age(current_date, date_of_birth))

Description: Checks that created_on timestamps are not in the future, which could indicate data entry errors or system clock issues.
Custom_SQL: SELECT customer_id, created_on FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE created_on > NOW()

Description: Checks that modified_on timestamps are not earlier than created_on, ensuring logical record update chronology.
Custom_SQL: SELECT customer_id, created_on, modified_on FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE modified_on IS NOT NULL AND created_on IS NOT NULL AND modified_on < created_on

Description: Checks that account_numbers values match an expected pattern (e.g., comma-separated digits), ensuring consistent storage of multiple account numbers.
Custom_SQL: SELECT customer_id, account_numbers FROM tsb.customer_data_bank WHERE account_numbers IS NOT NULL AND account_numbers !~* '^([0-9]+,)*[0-9]+$'
